intro: Willdenowia teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Willdenowia teres is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
